intro: Syngonanthus reflexus, commonly known as the reflexed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a reflexed or curled appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. Syngonanthus reflexus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
